alert.note: Alert for Hunterdon; Morris; Sussex; Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 26 at 9:38PM EDT until June 27 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... West Central Morris County in northern New Jersey... Central Hunterdon County in northwestern New Jersey... Southwestern Sussex County in northwestern New Jersey... Central Warren County in northwestern New Jersey... * Until midnight EDT. * At 938 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.5 to 1 inch in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. * Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Hopatcong, Hackettstown, Washington, High Bridge, Stanhope, Netcong, Clinton, Harmony, Oxford, Alpha, Glen Gardner, and Hampton. This includes the following highways... Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 19. Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 15 and 28. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.5-1 INCH IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
